intro: Micropeplis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. They are characterized by their small, yellow composite flowers and hairy, succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. Micropeplis species often grow in rocky soils and are drought-tolerant, making them well-suited for harsh desert environments. Their reproductive structures are typical of the Asteraceae family, featuring both ray and disk flowers that attract pollinators.
